intro: Anacyclodon, commonly known as the false sandalwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It consists of a single species, Anacyclodon scoparius, which is native to southern Africa. The plant is a shrub characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically with yellow or white petals. Anacyclodon is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
